github.name: GitHub Repository & Work Tracking
github.description: Access GitHub repositories, issues, pull requests, and project tracking context for execution planning

capabilities.repository_context: Read repository structures and relevant docs
capabilities.pull_requests: Track implementation progress and review artifacts

when_to_use: Task Manager translating stories into execution tasks
Connecting planning artifacts to implementation evidence
Reviewing historical decisions for dependency or scope clarity
example_queries: Create issues from these approved user stories
List open blockers tagged as backend
Map sprint stories to existing PRs
Show unresolved decisions related to authentication

agent_instructions.activation: Use when planning artifacts need to be linked to actual implementation tracking.
agent_instructions.usage: Convert approved stories into issues/epics and maintain traceability between docs and execution.
agent_instructions.integration: Reference issue/PR IDs in sprint-plan.md and implementation-readiness.md.

how_to_use.for_agents: Use this MCP to connect planning outputs with implementation execution in GitHub.
how_to_use.for_humans: Create a PAT with minimal scopes and configure environment variables before enabling.
setup_instructions: Create GitHub PAT with least privilege scopes for required operations
Install server package via npm or use npx
Configure MCP settings in VS Code/Copilot
security_warnings: Never commit tokens to version control
Prefer read-only scopes unless issue/PR write access is required
